page.title: 03HALL - SILVER JUBILEE FETE
page.content: On the 29th & 30th June 1985 we held a special 2 day fete on our Green to commemorate the {Silver Jubilee} of our Village Hall; the fete is usually a one day affair. It began with a carnival led by the Rose Queen's float, followed by floats from various village clubs. The fete was opened by Viscount Althorp (his sister is Diana, the Princess of Wales) - his father had officially opened the Hall in 1960. Soon a Wild West Show started up & BMX & Dog Training displays amused the crowd and there were stalls all around the Green. The Green became a mass of people laughing, running and enjoying themselves. In the school there was a photographic exhibition of Village History. Similar things happened on the Sunday plus the annual Round the Village Road Race. The weekend ended with a family barbecue.
